title: Distance from Earth when force is W/2

content.question: A rocket lifts a payload upward from the surface of Earth. The radius of Earth is R, and the weight of the payload on the surface of Earth is W. The force of Earth’s gravity on the payload is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mi>W</mi> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@394F@</annotation> </semantics> </math> when the rocket’s distance from the center of Earth is

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
